inclusion.criterion: clinically diagnosed uncomplicated acute appendicitis cases
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Computed Tomography of the abdomen with contrast shows the presence of a distended appendix with thickened appendiceal wall without perforation, abscess or gangrene.

inclusion.criterion: uncomplicated acute appendicitis cases who accepted the study protocol
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: She is a candidate for laparoscopic appendectomy under general anesthesia.

exclusion.criterion: clinically diagnosed complicated acute appendicitis cases
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: Computed Tomography of the abdomen with contrast shows the presence of a distended appendix with thickened appendiceal wall without perforation, abscess or gangrene.

exclusion.criterion: uncomplicated acute appendicitis cases who do not accept the study protocol
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: patients with any type of malignancy (appendix or other organ)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: patients with rheumatologic disease or blood diseases
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 31-year-old woman complaining of abdominal pain. She had poor appetite as well as malaise.
